value: <l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">We cannot hear them talking: the sound of the</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">to the speech of the [bible?] There is no</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">exhorts. She is a preacher advising a</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">subordinate. <del>She</del> <del>She</del> Fear of god,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">fear of man shroud her with the walls of a dungeon.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">They <del>are</del> Again, we cannot hear the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">voices they heard- the voice of the [mummers?], of the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">[illeg.]. [But?] we can see the path that led</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">to the well & the tree. It is an isolated</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">house: a house full of finery, <del>but</del></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The writer then must be a poet–– For</l>
